Description: Pottery sherd from a marl clay ‘decorated ware’ vessel decorated in red-brown paint with a representation of male figure holding a staff, with the remains of a vegetal motif to the righ
Curator's comments: Discussed in: G. Graff, Les peintures sur vases de Naqada I–Naqada II: Nouvelle approche sémiologique de l’iconographie prédynastique, Leuven (2009), cat. no. 597
Bibliographic references: Brunton & Caton-Thompson 1928 / The Badarian Civilisation and Predynastic Remains near Badari (45, pl. li.14; lviii.6)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
